page.title: 15Vicar of Upper Nidderdale
page.content: The Church of England's Vicar of Upper Nidderdale lives in Pateley with his wife and family. The Churches he is responsible for are at Middlesmoor, Ramsgill, Wilsill, Bewerley, Greenhow and Pateley Bridge. As his area is so large, he has two people to help him with his preaching. There are about three and a half thousand people in his parish. His day usually begins at 7:30am. He is in church every day at 8:30am. He rings the church bell to tell the local people he is there for prayer if they wish to join him. After this, his day is filled with letter writing, home and hospital visiting and he also has various meetings to attend. He also visits some of the local schools, runs the Followers Club on a Tuesday and the Youth Club on a Friday. His day usually ends at about 10:30pm.
